tweets.html:
I know I shouldn't care about Dads being renewed. I can easily continue not watching. BUT THOSE FUCKERS CANCELED FIREFLY, DAMMIT.

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) October 25, 2013

I don't have kids so I use TV to judge how time flies. "Criminal Minds is 9? Seems like just yesterday I was thinking it would never last."

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) October 26, 2013

perfecting my Low Winter Sun costume for halloween

— pilot (@pilotbacon) October 27, 2013

Before I go to bed, just a reminder that Julianne Hough wore blackface this weekend.

— billy eichner (@billyeichner) October 28, 2013

OUAT just told me to use the hashtag #Ariel this week if I believe in mermaids. I WILL NOT, ABC.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 28, 2013

@TVandDinners But you just did!!

Damn tricky mermaids. RT @insidethetube: @TVandDinners But you just did!!

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 28, 2013

Tom & Padma would be so much happier on "Top Chef" if there were salt shakers on the table. "This is underseasoned." (pause) "Fixed it."

My yearly plea to the TV Gods: Titus Welliver needs to be in EVERYTHING. EVER. RIGHT NOW.

— Lion-Hearted Girl (@letloverule42) October 28, 2013

Nothing pisses me off more than knowing Sylvester Stallone is better at painting than I am.

— kelly oxford (@kellyoxford) October 28, 2013

Shows that wouldn't benefit from Jane Espenson in the writers' room:

— Grace (@GemOfAmara) October 28, 2013

I wonder if Ethan on #MastersofSex knows he's that universe's Pete Campbell. Or if any universe's Pete Campbells know that about themselves.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) October 28, 2013

Remember Kim and the cougar on #24? So much better than what I am watching right now. #Homeland. Someone please hit Dana with a car.

— MariaElena Fernandez (@writerchica) October 28, 2013

I'm not watching this season of Walking Dead, but I'm guessing tonight's episode is where they all argue about a plan of action.

— Chris(tmas name) (@djgristle) October 27, 2013

The entire internet just turned from Lou Reed to Walking Dead spoilers in, like, two minutes.

— Dick Champagne (@DerekSheen) October 28, 2013

Damn. Maggie's gone from Laura Ingalls to Lara Croft. #TheWalkingDead

— Jedi Kristina (@meek_the_geek) October 28, 2013

Any idiot who follows a mysterious new blood trail in a zombie story deserves whatever s/he gets.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) October 28, 2013

Good news guys, The Walking Dead's new Indian character is a doctor and its new black character has anger issues.

— Zach 🚷 (@zhaldeman) October 28, 2013

Really guys? I know twitter is a safe space, I just didn't realize it was an "admit to watching Talking Dead" level safe space

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) October 28, 2013

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
Not sure who I hate more: Chris Hardwick or Kevin Smith. Luckily, AMC doesn't make us choose!

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) October 28, 2013

Hey guys, is everyone excited to watch #Revenge? Guys? guys?

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 28, 2013

Shirtless Wechsler. Take that, #TheGoodWife! #Revenge

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 28, 2013

I know no one believes me but #Revenge is SO FUN right now.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) October 28, 2013

The entire #RedSox team looks like the gang in the #walkingdead started a prison yard pickup game to keep their spirits up.

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) October 28, 2013

When Joe Buck says his partner will be along shortly, I imagine that McCarver is at a concession stand, yelling about catsup on hotdogs.

— Anthony Crupi (@crupicrupicrupi) October 28, 2013

If Fox cameraman hadn't been fixated on blonde Cardinals fan with a Fredbird, we would have seen the pickoff as it happened!

— Amanda Rykoff (@amandarykoff) October 28, 2013

We went from this chick to "this game is over"? I don't understand baseball. pic.twitter.com/bUPLN7am03

— Megan Ganz (@meganganz) October 28, 2013

Tomorrow's game probably ends with a falcon catching ball in its beak and dropping it over fence for walkoff.

— Seth Meyers (@sethmeyers) October 28, 2013

3 shows on television require wine as part of the viewing experience: Scandal, Cougar Town, and The Good Wife

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) October 28, 2013

All of the emoting being done by Josh Charles. #GoodWife

— Whitney McIntosh (@WhitneyM02) October 28, 2013

ALL OF THE DAVID BUCKLEY STRINGS. ALL OF THEM. #TheGoodWife

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) October 28, 2013

They picked it up just like they do on soap operas. From different angles and everything. This is ab to be a melodrama. #GoodWife

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) October 28, 2013

Hit desk little too hard on"You were poison" line on first take. Rookie mistake, but iced hand & got through it. #hittingthefan#thegoodwife

— Josh Charles (@MrJoshCharles) October 28, 2013

More has happened in the first 7 minutes of The Good Wife than happened in the first 3 seasons of The Walking Dead

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) October 28, 2013

Elevator gag based on every elevator ever entered while anxiously trying to get to late meeting. Yes, CBS elevators. #TheGoodWife

— Good Wife Writers (@GoodWifeWriters) October 28, 2013

David Lee lurves firing people. He lurves it more than M&Ms. #TheGoodWife

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) October 28, 2013

If the rest of this episode were just David Lee walking into rooms and firing people I think I'd be fine with it. #TheGoodWife

— Whitney McIntosh (@WhitneyM02) October 28, 2013

Someone needs to jerk that Bluetooth roach out of David Lee’s right ear. #TheGoodWife

— Kelli Marshall (@KelliMarshall) October 28, 2013

TV directors are more essential to TV than they are given credit for. Always amazing work under pressure. #TheGoodWife

— Good Wife Writers (@GoodWifeWriters) October 28, 2013

Cary, you could, for example, shut up. #TheGoodWife spill the beans much?

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) October 28, 2013

Some of this is based on people being fired at the Writers Guild. There's a harshness to people being escorted from their workplaces.

— Good Wife Writers (@GoodWifeWriters) October 28, 2013

It's really a perp walk. #TheGoodWife

— Good Wife Writers (@GoodWifeWriters) October 28, 2013

WHO THE HELL APPROVED COMMERCIAL BREAKS IN THIS "GOOD WIFE" EPISODE ARE YOU KIDDING ME THIS IS AN OUTRAGE

— Joe Reid (@joereid) October 28, 2013

The was more of a frigid open than a cold open #TheGoodWife

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) October 28, 2013

Ok. Angry #Willicia is everything. #TheGoodWife

— Nichole ✨✨✨ (@tnwhiskeywoman) October 28, 2013

Robert & Michelle King are MASTERS. If you want to write TV drama, study their work. Do it now. #TheGoodWife

— Eric Haywood (@EricHaywood) October 28, 2013

"It's Will. He's in commando mode. And not the...good kind that I used to really enjoy." #TheGoodWife

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) October 28, 2013

I'm practically purring over this Peter & Will conversation. #TheGoodWife

— Nichole ✨✨✨ (@tnwhiskeywoman) October 28, 2013

Oh goody, the Will and Peter dick-measuring hour has begun. Always a treat. #TheGoodWife

— Whitney McIntosh (@WhitneyM02) October 28, 2013

Meanwhile, that courier is having the best day. #TheGoodWife

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) October 28, 2013

If Aaron Paul pops up in the fourth act of tonight's #TheGoodWife Twitter will achieve full supernova.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) October 28, 2013

Man, do you guys like #TheGoodWife.

— Julie Hammerle🔨 (@JulieHammerle) October 28, 2013

Poor Diane. Still in her wedding outfit. Being slingshotted from one disaster to another. #TheGoodWife

— Good Wife Writers (@GoodWifeWriters) October 28, 2013

Look, I know "Tortious Interference" wouldn't be the BEST drag name ... but it wouldn't be the worst.

— Joe Reid (@joereid) October 28, 2013

this is baller TV. #TheGoodWife

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) October 28, 2013

What I'm saying is: when that sex scene happens, it's gon be GOOOOOD. Better than 'the wall.' #catchesmybreath #GoodWife

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) October 28, 2013

Maybe your law firm's real problem is that your partners have a $10,000 stipend to decorate their offices. #TheGoodWife

— itsonlyzach (@itsonlyzach) October 28, 2013

I love that #TheGoodWife shows a 40ish woman w a healthy sex life that's not bc some young stud awakened her.

— Nichole ✨✨✨ (@tnwhiskeywoman) October 28, 2013

Just some stuff. The story was pulled together fast in the writer's room. About five days. Fast for us. #TheGoodWife

— Good Wife Writers (@GoodWifeWriters) October 28, 2013

Alicia "blah-blah-blah" hand-gesture gif NOW, internet. #GoodWife

— Joe Reid (@joereid) October 28, 2013

YESSSSSSSSS #AliciaHandGIF RT @kimmyswimmy http://t.co/253OgTCkuL…

— Joe Reid (@joereid) October 28, 2013

Alicia Florrick is my hero. Bow down. #TheGoodWife

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) October 28, 2013

I know that look Alicia is giving Peter. And you know what? Here we go. Alicia: one of two women who gets more...<SIGNAL LOST> #GoodWife

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) October 28, 2013

Chris Noth is achieving levels of sexual tension with Julianna Margulies unseen since his work with Jerry Orbach

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) October 28, 2013

Did Good Wife win the race to making double entendre "lean in" joke?

— Willa Paskin (@willapaskin) October 28, 2013

If Alicia wasn't thinking of Will at all during those ten minutes, I'd be amazed. Very amazed. #TheGoodWife

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) October 28, 2013

Honestly, guys, that is only like the 11,285th most unethical thing an Illinois governor has done. Since 1975. #TheGoodWife

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) October 28, 2013

Ethics are not always a good thing on our show. #TheGoodWife

— Good Wife Writers (@GoodWifeWriters) October 28, 2013

We need a 90 minute episode of #TheGoodWife

— æon flux capacitor (@HereIsMySpout) October 28, 2013

Name me one show that isn't improved by @MrJoshCharles drinking brown liquor, you can't can you?

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) October 28, 2013

#TheGoodWife knows you can't become a great network drama by being the show it was tonight from day one. You build. You grow. You thrive.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) October 28, 2013

I think Will Gardner just flipped his humanity switch off. I think I like it. #TheGoodWife #TheVampireDiaries #TVD

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) October 28, 2013

Will telling Alicia about Grace's permission slip is the biggest laugh I've had all fall. #TheGoodWife

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) October 28, 2013

Cary Agos is such a good character we're all willing to overlook Matt Czuchry's run as Logan on GG and in that Tucker Max movie

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) October 28, 2013

Alicia Florrick = Walter White

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) October 28, 2013

Thanks so much. I hope you liked the episode. It was fun to make. Not all are. #TheGoodWife

— Good Wife Writers (@GoodWifeWriters) October 28, 2013

GOOD GRIEF. THAT PROMO. #TheGoodWife

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) October 28, 2013

That #goodwife promo alone was better than a whole season of most other network dramas.

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) October 28, 2013

That the "Good Wife" people thought to include Mamie Gummer in their super-tease proves that they really do care about me.

— Joe Reid (@joereid) October 28, 2013

Seriously though tonight's The Good Wife is why there will ALWAYS be a home for network dramas in my life, very different feel than cable

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) October 28, 2013

Soooooooooo pissed the game went long and my DVR cut off the last 10 minutes of @TheGoodWife_CBS ##repeatplease

— Debra Messing (@DebraMessing) October 28, 2013

@DebraMessing @TheGoodWife_CBS Debra, call me and we'll act it out over the phone for you :-)

— Josh Charles (@MrJoshCharles) October 28, 2013

Here are my Sunday night TV choices: watched Carrie Mathison be stupid or watch Alicia Florrick kick ass.

— Lauren Chval (@lchval) October 28, 2013

Really though, there's absolutely no such thing as a law firm with 2 men named Cary. #TheGoodWife

— itsonlyzach (@itsonlyzach) October 28, 2013

Will relaying Grace's message to Alicia wins. What does it win? EVERYTHING. #TheGoodWife

— Melissa Mann (@PhantomRat) October 28, 2013

I hope this episode of #TheGoodWife never ends. I want to watch it for the rest of my life.

— Melissa Mann (@PhantomRat) October 28, 2013

Tonight's episode of The Good Wife cured my liver disease! (OK, it only cured my lazy eye. But it was as exciting as promised.)

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) October 28, 2013

I would like to make out with the scenes from upcoming episodes of #TheGoodWife. I would like to go under the sweater of those scenes.

I think Jason Katims and Robert&Michelle King should have a 'guest-star-off.' #RealityShowIdeas

this season has to contain a very angry will and alicia sex scene IT HAS TO.

What Aaron Sorkin did for the 'walk-and-talk,' Robert & Michelle King have done for the 'walk-and-not-talk.' #TheGoodWife
